00031 /// Mutex class.
00032 /// This class that encapsulates a platform-specific mutex facility.
00033 /// @class Mutex
00034 
00035 // Linux-specific declarations
00036 #if PLATFORM(Linux)
00037 struct mutex_t
00038 {
00039    /// Native Linux mutex handle.
00040    pthread_mutex_t handle;
00041 };
00042 #endif
00043 
00044 // Windows-specific declarations
00045 #if PLATFORM(Windows)
00046 struct mutex_t
00047 {
00048    /// Native Windows mutex handle.
00049    HANDLE handle;
00050 };
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00054 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00055 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00056 
00057 /** Creates a Mutex instance.
00058     @fn mutex_t* mutex_create(void)
00059 
00060     @return
00061     address of Mutex created
00062 
00063     @post
00064     Either succeeds or aborts application.
00065 
00066     @memberof Mutex
00067 */
00068 
00069 #if PLATFORM(Linux)
00070 mutex_t* mutex_create(void)
00071 {
00072    int result;
00073    mutex_t* mutex = (mutex_t*)calloc(1, sizeof(mutex_t));
00074 
00075    // memory allocation successful ?
00076    assert(mutex);
00077 
00078    // initializes mutex
00079    result = pthread_mutex_init(&mutex->handle, NULL);
00080    assert(result == 0);
00081 
00082    return mutex;
00083 }
00084 #endif
00085 
00086 #if PLATFORM(Windows)
00087 TC2API mutex_t* mutex_create(void)
00088 {
00089    mutex_t* mutex = (mutex_t*)calloc(1, sizeof(mutex_t));
00090 
00091    // memory allocation successful ?
00092    assert(mutex);
00093 
00094    mutex->handle = CreateMutex(
00095       NULL,  // LPSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES
00096       FALSE, // initial owner
00097       NULL   // name
00098       );
00099 
00100    assert(mutex->handle);
00101 
00102    return mutex;
00103 }
00104 #endif
00105 
00106 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00107 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00108 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00109 
00110 /** Locks a Mutex.
00111     @fn void mutex_lock(mutex_t* mutex)
00112 
00113     @param [in]
00114     mutex : address of mutex to be locked.
00115 
00116     @post
00117     Either succeeds or aborts application.
00118 
00119     @memberof Mutex
00120 */
00121 
00122 #if PLATFORM(Linux)
00123 void mutex_lock(const mutex_t* mutex)
00124 {
00125    int result = pthread_mutex_lock(&(((mutex_t*)mutex)->handle));
00126    assert(result == 0);
00127 }
00128 #endif
00129 
00130 #if PLATFORM(Windows)
00131 TC2API void mutex_lock(const mutex_t* mutex)
00132 {
00133    DWORD result = WaitForSingleObject(mutex->handle, INFINITE);
00134    assert(result == WAIT_OBJECT_0);
00135 }
00136 #endif
00137 
00138 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00139 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00140 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00141 
00142 /** Unlocks a mutex.
00143     @fn void mutex_unlock(mutex_t* mutex)
00144 
00145     @param [in]
00146     mutex : address of mutex to be unlocked.
00147 
00148     @post
00149     Either succeeds or aborts application.
00150 
00151     @memberof Mutex
00152 */
00153 
00154 #if PLATFORM(Linux)
00155 void mutex_unlock(const mutex_t* mutex)
00156 {
00157    int result = pthread_mutex_unlock(&(((mutex_t*)mutex)->handle));
00158    assert(result == 0);
00159 }
00160 #endif
00161 
00162 #if PLATFORM(Windows)
00163 TC2API void mutex_unlock(const mutex_t* mutex)
00164 {
00165    ReleaseMutex(mutex->handle);
00166 }
00167 #endif
